not connected with or coming from a recognized office or authority: We think of him as the unofficial town historian. unofficially adverb us
Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio
/ˌʌn·əˈfɪʃ·ə·li/
Unemployment has been unofficially estimated at 70%.
Add to word list
Add to word list
not officially approved by a person in authority, the government, etc.: unofficial estimates/figures/targets Profits were below unofficial estimates.unofficial data/reports/results Based on early and unofficial data, the Dow Jones industrial average fell 10.12 points.
not part of an official plan or someone's official business: an unofficial policy/visit The company has an unofficial policy of allowing a number of houses to fall into disrepair before seeking private contractors to do the work. Compare
official adjective unofficially adverb
He said he had been given the information unofficially.
